result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly John Grajek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Violate State/County Institution Laws [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment and/or schooling

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management.   Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kelly John Grajek in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Defendant Kelly John Grajek in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 2, 3 & 4.  State moves to dismiss read in Count 1.    No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court addresses waiving the PSI.  Defendant agrees.  Defendant is currently incarcerated.  Defendant questions CIP and ERP.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Attorney Steinman makes final statement.  Credit will be by stipulation.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 2:
WI State Prison for 2 years (18 months Initial Confinement/6 months Extended Supervision)  Consecutive to any other sentences.  
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent to include anger management.  
Absolute sobierty.
No entry into tavern or liquor stores
Obtain and maintain full time employment and/or schooling
AODA & treatment
Restitution w/ 15% Surcharge To: TBD
$443.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Earned Release

Court withholds sentence.
Count 3 & 4:
2 years Probation, consecutive Count 2  & any other sentences.
Restitution w/ 15% Surcharge To: TBD
Any other conditions that agent recommends.  
$243.00 x 2 & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Felony admonishments.
Return date on June 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
